title: names to these fonts?
content:
Double wammy here:

first up:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122025955im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/zoom-3_5734.jpg)

second:  
(this may be custom, but I think I’ve seen it before)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122025955im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/44_6p-1%20copy_6393.jpg)

 [‹ Climate](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122025955/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48181 "Go to previous forum topic") [HELP :: Misc. Serif in Italics? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122025955/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48182 "Go to next forum topic")
author: thompson

comments.content:
The top one was [identified before](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122025955/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20844) as ITC Firenze. The bottom one is Motter Ombra.

- Lex

Awesome guys, thanks!!

I need to spend more time around these parts, as well.
i am trying to find this font and have looked all over the place, can someone please help me

_i am trying to find this font and have looked all over the place, can someone please help me_

Start a new thread and post an image.

Mike says ITC Firenze comes with [Corel Draw 8](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122025955/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13289). Motter Ombra was not officially digitized but you’ll probably find a russion version called Motter Hombre.
BTW, you’ll find the heirs of the original Motterfonts-designer [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122025955/http:/www.motterfonts.com/).
